meanings.definition: Of, relating to, or characteristic of a satyr.
meanings.sent1: The play had a satyrical theme, with characters dressed as mythical creatures.
meanings.sent2: Her satyrical laughter echoed through the forest, making everyone uneasy.
meanings.sent3: The satyrical dance routine at the party had everyone laughing.
meanings.sent4: His satyrical behavior at the office made him the subject of gossip.
meanings.sent5: The satyrical mask he wore at the masquerade ball was both eerie and captivating.

meanings.definition: Resembling or suggestive of a satyr in being lecherous or having a lustful nature.
meanings.sent1: The movie portrayed the villain with a satyrical grin, hinting at his sinister intentions.
meanings.sent2: Her satyrical gaze made it clear she was up to no good.
meanings.sent3: The satyrical wink he gave her across the room made her blush.
meanings.sent4: The dark alley had a satyrical atmosphere, sending shivers down her spine.
meanings.sent5: The old painting had a satyrical charm, drawing viewers in with its mysterious allure.
